author: TerreHaute

review: This is astonishing to me that I cannot do a true "mirror" from my iPod screen to the big screen. Specifically I bought this device so that I could launch the HBO Go app and watch my paid subscription through Airplay on the Apple TV. But the app says it doesn't support HDMI output. It's unforgivable how limited the Airplay is and how it doesn't truly let you use all your device's apps on the big screen. This fractured experience just makes me want to veto the whole entertainment media establishment. Oh, BTW, the Apple TV is nice, as long as it lasts longer than my Roku (cheap box broke), and I like the movie trailers and all the other content in HD. Very nice.
author: Amazon Customer "Josh"

review: I live in a dorm, so the Apple TV's wifi related features do not work correctly yet, (They work at home) such as the remote app and airplay from an iOS device. But it is hooked into the ethernet and connects to my MacBook Pro through the ethernet network. I play my iTunes and mirror my desktop to it perfectly. It's hooked up to an Onkyo TX-NR616 and does everything perfectly. It outputs to HDMI and Digital Optical at the same time, which is perfect for when I don't need video. Overall it's a perfect addition to make listening or watching your media easier and better.
